intro: Koeleria cantabrica, commonly known as the Cantabrian grass or narrowleaf grass, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Koeleria cantabrica is often found in open habitats such as cliffs and sandy soils.
